title: Dynamic tab name
author: cwi-ezoutas
body_snippet:
It would be very useful to have dynamic tab naming for ssh connections.
Example:
1) Connect to "Server A" as user "testor" where hostname is "servera"
2) Tab should be named "testor@servera (Server A)"
3) SSH from "Server A" to another server at IP 192.168.1.2 with user "test"
4) Tab should be named "test@192.168.1.2 (Server A)"

This is extremely useful when you manage hundred of servers.
This is the same with:
https://mremoteng.atlassian.net/browse/MR-571

Could not find the same ti...

iterations.description: Feature request to dynamically update tab titles to reflect the remote session's window title (e.g., PuTTY progress), improving usability for multi-session workflows

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
Step 4 is currently not possible without significantly changing PuTTY.

We may be able to look into this once PuTTY is replaced by SSH.Net (#181)

notes:
AI triage: Feature request to dynamically update tab titles to reflect the remote session's window title (e.g., PuTTY progress), improving usability for multi-session workflows
Approach: Subscribe to the embedded process/control window title changes (via WinEvents or polling NativeWindow text) and propagate updates to the tab header, with an opt-in setting in ConnectionInfo to enable dynamic tab naming
